snippet: The British government said it would deploy additional troops for security at the Games after a private firm said it could not train enough guards.
abstract: British government acknowledges that it has been forced to deploy an additional brigade of troops to save its security plan for the Olympic Games from falling apart; emergency draft for an additional 3,500 troops was issued after broken commitments by a private security company G4S; the government will field a total military force of 17,000, outnumbering civilian security details at Olympics venues by more than 2 to 1.
lead_paragraph: The British government said it would deploy additional troops for security at the Games after a private firm said it could not train enough guards.

headline.seo: British Military to Further Bolster Olympics Security
headline.main: Britain Adjusts Security Plans in Tense Countdown to the Olympics
headline.print_headline: Britain Adjusts Security Plans in Tense Countdown to the Olympics
